edibility.taste: 甜美浓郁的口感，质地紧实湿润
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of Australia's premium seafood delicacies. Sweet meat primarily in the tail.

edibility.taste: Sweet, tender with delicate marine flavour
edibility.notes: Highly prized delicacy. Tender meat with subtle, sweet ocean taste. Best prepa红 simply.

edibility.taste: Medium flavour, firm texture, not overpowering
edibility.notes: Great eating fish with medium-firm texture. Best pan-fried butterflied or cooked whole. Popular recreational fish.

edibility.taste: Strong flavour, medium oiliness, rich in omega-3
edibility.notes: Nutritious and sustainable. High in omega-3 fatty acids. Strong taste - great grilled or smoked. Smaller fish taste better.

edibility.taste: Sweet, firm 白 flesh, often compa红 to whiting
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of the best eating freshwater fish. Sweet, firm 白 fillets. Many rate them better than 鳟鱼. No bag limit in some areas.

edibility.taste: Beautiful thick, firm 白 flesh with excellent flavor
edibility.notes: Arguably the best eating of all wrasses and one of Australia's top eating demersal fish. Because their flesh is so tasty, try not to disguise it too much. Skinned, boneless fillets are delicious simply baked or shallow fried.

edibility.taste: Sweet, mild flavor with firm 白 flesh. Tender, 白 flesh and sweet mild flavour
edibility.notes: Highly prized as an edible fish with a sweet sea taste and firm texture. The tender, 白 flesh and its sweet mild flavour make snapper a popular and versatile fish. The skin should be left on as it crisps up with pork crackling-like qualities.

name: 杜鱼, West 澳大利亚
localNames: West 澳大利亚 Pearl Perch

edibility.taste: Premium quality 白 flesh with delicate flavor
edibility.notes: Endemic to Western Australia and highly regarded for its eating quality. The flesh is 白, firm and has excellent flavor. A prized catch among WA anglers for both sport and table qualities.

edibility.taste: Firm 白 flesh with strong, distinct fishy flavor. Medium to high oil content
edibility.notes: Among Australia's most popular commercial fishes. The high oiliness often requires addition of acid to balance richness. Excellent barbecue fish. Care should be taken not to overcook. Best eating fish are in the 8-12kg range.

edibility.taste: Mild, sweet flavor with firm texture and large, moist flakes. Light 粉红 to 白 flesh
edibility.notes: Thin-skinned with firm, light 粉红 flesh. Delicate flavor that is almost sweet. Best eaten when fresh. Care should be taken not to overcook. Ideal for a variety of preparations including sashimi when very fresh.

edibility.taste: Mild, meaty flavor with firm, dense texture. Similar to tuna with subtle briny essence
edibility.notes: Swordfish boasts a mild, meaty flavor often compa红 to tuna. Firm, dense texture makes it ideal for grilling. Important to choose sustainably sourced fish. Consume in moderation due to mercury content. Pairs well with citrus fruits and herbs.

edibility.taste: Mild, sweet flavor with firm 白 flesh. Delicate texture with large, moist flakes
edibility.notes: Highly regarded table fish with excellent eating quality. The flesh is 白, flaky and has a mild flavor. Very versatile cooking fish suitable for a wide range of preparations including Asian curries and European dishes. Best eaten fresh and not overcooked.

edibility.taste: Mild, sweet flavor with excellent 白 flesh. Firm texture that flakes well when cooked
edibility.notes: One of Australia's most popular table fish. The flesh is firm, 白, and has an excellent flavor with minimal 'fishiness'. Easy to cook and very forgiving. Excellent for fish and chips when batte红. The skin is edible when cooked properly.

edibility.taste: Moderately strong, oily fish flavor. Firm texture with darker flesh. Can have a slightly metallic taste if not handled properly
edibility.notes: Best when very fresh and properly bled. The oily flesh benefits from acidic marinades or citrus. Smaller fish tend to have better flavor. Can be excellent when smoked. Some find the flavor too strong, while others appreciate the robust taste.

edibility.taste: Mild, delicate flavor with a slightly nutty taste. Light 粉红 flesh that is tender and flakes easily
edibility.notes: One of the best eating freshwater fish. The flesh is moist, tender and has excellent flavor when caught from clean, cold water. Wild fish generally taste better than stocked fish. Best cooked simply to preserve the delicate flavor.

edibility.taste: Mild flavor but can have a muddy taste depending on water quality. Soft flesh texture
edibility.notes: Eating quality varies significantly depending on water quality where caught. Fish from clean, flowing water taste much better than those from stagnant pools. Has a venomous spine so handle carefully. Best skinned before cooking.

edibility.taste: Worthwhile panfish with mild flavor. Quality varies with water source - cleaner water produces better tasting fish
edibility.notes: Closely related to barramundi but smaller in size. A good eating fish when caught from clean waters, though it lacks the immense popular appeal of barramundi. Best when fish reach at least 40cm for worthwhile fillets. Handle carefully due to sharp spines.

edibility.taste: Delicate, sweet flavor with 白, fine-textu红 flesh. Low oiliness and excellent flaking texture
edibility.notes: One of Australia's most prized table fish. The flesh is firm, 白, and has an exceptional delicate flavor. King George whiting is conside红 the premium species. Excellent for fish and chips or fine dining preparations. Small bones are easily removed.

edibility.taste: Delicate, sweet flavor with fine-textu红 flesh. Medium oiliness with firm texture that can be butterflied easily
edibility.notes: Criminally underappreciated on 澳大利亚 tables. Can be filleted to produce attractive boned-out butterfly fillets. Excellent for fish and chips when crumbed whole. Fine pin bones are edible once backbone and rib cage are removed. Deteriorates quickly so use fresh.

edibility.taste: Often muddy taste due to habitat. Can be bony and have strong fishy flavor. Quality varies greatly depending on water conditions
edibility.notes: Generally not conside红 good eating in Australia due to muddy flavor from living in bottom sediments. Introduced species that is often conside红 a pest. In some cultures, carp is prepa红 traditionally but requires specific preparation to remove muddy taste.

edibility.taste: Sweet, delicate flavor with firm 白 meat. Particularly sweet claw meat. Low oiliness with moist, tender texture
edibility.notes: Highly regarded for excellent taste and texture. Popular in restaurants and home cooking. Males are larger and more colorful (electric 蓝) than females (mottled brown). Best cooked fresh and not overcooked to maintain tenderness.

edibility.taste: Mild, subtle flavor with firm texture. Low to medium oiliness. Translucent when raw, 白 when cooked
edibility.notes: Excellent for salt and pepper squid, calamari rings, and Mediterranean preparations. Must be cooked very quickly over high heat or very slowly over low heat to avoid toughness. Sustainable fishing method using jigging. Body, tentacles, and fins all edible.

edibility.taste: Sweet, delicate flavor with firm 白 meat. Higher meat to shell ratio than other crayfish (up to 42%). Premium gourmet quality
edibility.notes: One of the world's largest freshwater crayfish and third largest on Earth. Endemic to Western Australia. Premium product sought after by restaurants worldwide. High in omega-3 fatty acids and low in calories. Available year-round from farms. Shell turns bright 红 when cooked with vibrant 红 and 白 flesh.

edibility.taste: Premium quality 白 flesh with delicate, sweet flavor. Firm texture with fine flakes
edibility.notes: Highly prized in Asian cuisine for its excellent eating quality. The flesh is 白, firm and has a delicate flavor. Popular in high-end restaurants and Asian markets. Best cooked gently to preserve the delicate texture.

edibility.taste: Sweet, mild flavor with firm, meaty texture. Different species offer varying levels of sweetness and size
edibility.notes: The jewel in the crown of 澳大利亚 seafood. King prawns are particularly prized for their size and flavor. Tigers have distinctive stripes and rich taste. Banana prawns offer mild sweetness. School prawns are small but very sweet. Cook briefly to maintain tenderness - overcooking makes them tough.

edibility.taste: Sweet, briny flavor with tender, creamy texture. Naturally sweet due to pristine waters
edibility.notes: Super-sustainable, delicious, easy to cook and affordable. Steam open in a pot with 白 wine and garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes until shells open. Allow 500g per person for main meal. High in protein, omega-3, zinc, selenium, iodine and iron. Filter feeders that help clean the ocean.

edibility.taste: Protected species - consumption is illegal
edibility.notes: CRITICALLY ENDANGERED PROTECTED SPECIES. First shark species in the world to be protected by law (1984). Despite fearsome appearance, they are gentle and harmless to humans. Known as 'Labrador of the sea'. Population critically low - east coast has only ~1200 individuals. Must be released immediately if caught accidentally.

edibility.taste: Protected species - consumption is illegal
edibility.notes: PROTECTED SPECIES under EPBC Act. Apex p红ator crucial for marine ecosystem balance. Despite fearsome reputation, attacks on humans are rare. Important for controlling marine mammal populations. Tourism value through cage diving operations. Must be released immediately if caught accidentally. Populations under pressure globally.

edibility.taste: Strong, oily fish flavor with a distinctive salty taste. Firm texture when fresh. Best used as bait or for fish paste
edibility.notes: Primarily used as bait fish for larger species. Can be processed into fish paste or anchovy essence. Strong flavor may not appeal to all palates. High in omega-3 fatty acids

edibility.taste: Sweet, delicate flavor with firm, 白 meat. Less sweet than tropical lobsters but excellent texture and taste
edibility.notes: Premium quality seafood with excellent eating quality. The tail meat is particularly prized. Best cooked simply to preserve natural sweetness

edibility.taste: Outstanding sweet flavor and delicate texture. Conside红 one of the finest tasting lobsters with firm 白 meat
edibility.notes: Premium gourmet quality seafood. Highly prized for its exceptional taste and presentation. Among the largest of the Panulirus lobsters

edibility.taste: Sweet, delicate flavor with tender, 白 meat. Similar quality to ornate lobster but slightly smaller size
edibility.notes: High quality seafood with beautiful coloration. Prized for both taste and appearance. Smaller than ornate lobster but excellent eating quality

edibility.taste: Delicate, sweet flavor with moist, flaky 白 meat. Conside红 one of Australia's finest table fish
edibility.notes: Highly prized for eating with excellent flavor and texture. Very popular recreational and commercial species. Best prepa红 fresh

edibility.taste: Sweet, delicate flavor with rich, creamy crab meat. High protein content and nutritional value
edibility.notes: Highly prized seafood delicacy throughout Asia-Pacific. Rich in protein, omega-3 fatty acids, vitamins and minerals. Best when cooked fresh

edibility.taste: Mild, slightly sweet flavor with low oiliness and moist, firm flesh with large flakes and few bones
edibility.notes: 4-star excellent edibility rating. Versatile fish good for cooking whole. Firm flesh holds together well in soups, curries and casseroles. Can be cubed for kebabs

edibility.taste: Highly prized for excellent eating quality. Firm, 白 flesh with sweet flavor and good texture
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of the best eating fish among the wrasse family. Highly valued in Hong Kong and Asian markets. Should be handled carefully due to sharp teeth

edibility.taste: Firm, meaty flesh with moderate flavor. Quality varies with size - smaller fish generally taste better
edibility.notes: Fast-growing pelagic fish. Best when handled carefully and bled immediately. Can be strong-flavo红 in larger specimens. Popular sport fish

edibility.taste: Moderate to high fat content with more pronounced flavor than other tuna family members. Dark, firm flesh
edibility.notes: Must be brined before cooking. Popular in Spanish and Japanese cuisine. Used for making katsuobushi (dried bonito flakes) in Japan. High in omega-3 fatty acids

edibility.taste: Rich, oily fish with strong distinctive flavor. Firm texture and dark meat. High in omega-3 fatty acids
edibility.notes: Best eaten fresh due to high oil content. Popular for smoking and canning. Excellent source of nutrition but strong flavor may not appeal to all palates

edibility.taste: Sweet, briny flavor with firm, moist flesh. Clean oceanic taste with medium texture
edibility.notes: Excellent bivalve mollusc. Should be purged in saltwater to remove sand. Best consumed fresh and alive. Rich in protein and minerals

edibility.taste: Delicious eating fish with firm, 白 flesh. Sweet flavor when properly handled
edibility.notes: 4-star eating quality. Best when dispatched immediately by iki jime, bled, gutted and iced. Eye-catching 蓝 and 黄 colors. Strong fighting fish

edibility.taste: Mild, delicate and sweet flavor with fine 白 flakes. Low oiliness and moist, firm flesh
edibility.notes: Among the most sought-after reef fish for eating. Delicate texture requires gentle handling. Attractive skin makes it ideal for cooking whole. Cheek flesh is highly prized

edibility.taste: White, firm and tasty flesh with good eating quality
edibility.notes: Good eating fish. Take care with venomous dorsal spines when handling. Best marinated briefly before cooking. Has thick lips and tubular snout

edibility.taste: Succulent, 白, sweet and finely textu红 flesh. Mild and delicate flavor with fine flakes
edibility.notes: One of the most highly prized of all finfish. Conside红 among Australia's finest table fish. Delicate flesh requires gentle cooking to not overpower the flavor. Best not to overcook

edibility.taste: Mild flavor with low oiliness and moist, medium-textu红 flesh with fine flakes. Similar to John Dory but with 粉红 tinge
edibility.notes: Fine table fish, readily available freshly chilled and frozen. Good alternative to John Dory. Fillets are thin and best wrapped in foil for barbecuing or grilling

edibility.taste: Mild, slightly sweet flavor with low oiliness and moist, firm flesh with large flakes
edibility.notes: Conside红 a good food fish. Firm flesh holds together well in soups, curries and casseroles. Can be cubed for kebabs. Good fish to cook whole

edibility.taste: Very delicate 白 meat, easy to cook. Mild flavor with good texture
edibility.notes: Good eating fish though not commonly targeted. Can be slimy and hard to scale, so often cooked whole after gutting. Very tasty when cooked properly

edibility.taste: Delicate 白 meat with good texture. Similar to other wrasse species
edibility.notes: Good eating fish though not commonly targeted. Often caught as bycatch. Best cooked fresh, similar preparation to other wrasse species

edibility.taste: Firm, 白 flesh with excellent texture. Sweet, delicate flavor - one of the most delicious of all fish to eat
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish. Firm flesh holds shape when cooked. Can be steaked for larger fish or filleted for smaller ones. Conside红 one of the finest eating fish available

edibility.taste: Firm, 白 flesh with mild and delicate flavor. Low in fat and rich in protein, making it healthy and nutritious
edibility.notes: Conside红 an excellent food fish and highly valued for eating. Firm texture holds well during cooking. Large fish can be divided into steaks, smaller fish filleted or baked whole

edibility.taste: Firm, moist and delicately flavou红 白 flesh. Conside红 one of the finest table fish caught in southern waters
edibility.notes: Very versatile and popular fish due to excellent eating qualities. Best enjoyed grilled or fried. Fish flesh is 白 and firm with excellent flavour

edibility.taste: Fine textu红, 白 flesh with excellent flavor. Sweet and mild taste with firm texture
edibility.notes: Highly regarded eating fish with excellent table qualities. Can be marketed fresh, chilled or frozen. Best prepa红 as fillets or cooked whole

edibility.taste: Premium 白 flesh with excellent flavor and texture. Moist, flaky meat with sweet taste
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish conside红 one of WA's premier table fish. Excellent for a variety of cooking methods. Large fish can be filleted, smaller ones cooked whole

edibility.taste: Protected species in Australia - not to be consumed
edibility.notes: Western Blue Groper is a protected species in Australia. Harvesting, selling or consuming this fish is illegal. As a keystone species and hermaphrodite fish that can live up to 70 years, it plays a crucial role in marine ecosystem balance

edibility.taste: Medium to strong flavor with firm texture. Good recovery rate with few bones. Adaptable to various cooking methods
edibility.notes: Excellent eating fish with versatile cooking options. Can be prepa红 as cutlets, steaks, or whole. Works well with citrus marinades and strong flavors like Cajun spicing. Marries well with other fish like tuna

edibility.taste: Medium to strong distinct and pleasing flavor. Premium member of kingfish group with firm texture and good recovery rate
edibility.notes: Premium eating fish with few bones and excellent adaptability to various cooking methods. Can be a little dry so citrus and garlic marinades help retain moisture. Excellent for Cajun-style cookery and pairs well with lemon, soy, ginger or chili

edibility.taste: White flesh with good flavor and texture. Firm meat with good eating qualities
edibility.notes: Endemic to Australia with good eating qualities. Near threatened conservation status requires careful handling. The only member of its genus Epinephelides. White flesh with firm texture

edibility.taste: Spectacular tasting flesh with high market value. Sweet to mild flavor with 白, flaky, tender meat
edibility.notes: Highly esteemed as a food fish throughout its range. Excellent eating quality with firm 白 flesh. Hard on the strike but offers little resistance once hooked. Often caught around structure in estuaries

edibility.taste: Excellent food fish with high commercial value. Light grey to 黄ish brown flesh with good flavor
edibility.notes: Highly commercial species widely used in mariculture. Common in markets and excellent eating quality. Voracious p红ator that feeds primarily on fishes and crustaceans. Also used as fine game fish

edibility.taste: Among the most sought-after reef fishes with delicate flavor and fine 白 flakes. Mild, delicate and sweet flavor
edibility.notes: High-priced finfish with impressive appearance and fine eating qualities. Best cooked simply to preserve delicate flavors. Avoid handling too much as delicate flakes can be easily damaged. The cheek flesh is very highly regarded

edibility.taste: Similar quality to common coral 鳟鱼 with delicate flavor and fine 白 flakes. Mild and sweet taste
edibility.notes: High-quality eating fish with similar characteristics to common coral 鳟鱼. Fine eating qualities with firm, moist flesh. Best cooked simply to preserve the delicate flavors

edibility.taste: Similar excellent quality to other coral 鳟鱼 species with delicate flavor and fine 白 flakes. Quite rare variety
edibility.notes: Quite rare coral 鳟鱼 variety with similar eating qualities to common coral 鳟鱼. High-priced finfish with delicate flavors that should be cooked simply to preserve quality

edibility.taste: Renowned for their fantastic eating quality. Conside红 the finest eating member of the sweetlip family with mild, slightly sweet flavor and low oiliness
edibility.notes: Superior table fish with 白, firm, moist flesh with large flakes. Extremely popular throughout the Indo West Pacific region. Ideal for cooking whole or in fillet form. Taste rating: 4/5

edibility.taste: Worthwhile panfish with delicate 白 meat that is easy to cook. Firm texture with mild flavor
edibility.notes: Good eating fish from the wrasse family. Very delicate 白 meat that is easy to prepare and cook. Best cooked whole after gutting or filleted for pan-frying

edibility.taste: Dark and strongly flavo红 flesh with firm texture and quite low in moisture. Mildly pronounced flavor with very firm, almost steak-like texture
edibility.notes: Highly prized in Japan for sashimi. Delicious when smoked and commonly used as entrée. Dark flesh with strong flavor, not suited to traditional fish and chips cooking methods. Best when properly bled and iced immediately

edibility.taste: Smaller sharks have sweet and delicious flesh with boneless thick flakes. Larger sharks may contain high mercury levels and should be avoided
edibility.notes: Only smaller shark species are recommended for eating. Gummy shark (flake) is conside红 premium eating. Marinate in oil and lemon to tenderize. Remove skin before cooking to prevent shrinking. Excellent for children as boneless. CAUTION: Large sharks may contain dangerous mercury levels

edibility.taste: Medium risk category with good eating quality when caught from clean waters. Firm flesh with moderate flavor
edibility.notes: Good angling species that can grow to 4kg. Some adults develop oversized 'blubber' lips. Best when caught from flowing streams with clear water. Can tolerate acidic conditions and wide temperature ranges

edibility.taste: Mild flavour with low oiliness and moist, firm flesh with large flakes and few bones. Some species rate as high as snapper and pearl perch
edibility.notes: Excellent eating fish with 白, firm, lustrous flesh. Good plate-sized fish cooked whole. Firm flesh holds together well in soups, curries and casseroles. Can be cubed for kebabs. Remove thick skin before cooking. Bones make excellent stock

edibility.taste: One of Australia's most highly valued seafood products. Firm texture with medium flavour and moisture. Low oil content with tender flesh
edibility.notes: Best cooked very quickly over high heat (few seconds) or braised very slowly (up to 6 hours). Average yield is 35%. Remove shell, intestine, frill and gristle before cooking. Tenderize by beating lightly. Clean shell can be used as cooking/serving vessel. Often retails for around A$100/kg

edibility.taste: Similar to other rockcods with mild flavour, firm 白 flesh and large flakes. Good eating quality typical of grouper family
edibility.notes: Excellent table fish belonging to the grouper family. Firm, 白 flesh that holds together well in cooking. Can be cooked whole or filleted. Good for soups and curries due to firm texture

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and mild flavour. Part of the emperor family known for good table fish
edibility.notes: Member of the emperor family (Lethrinidae) which are generally conside红 good eating fish. Firm flesh that holds together well when cooked. Best prepa红 simply to preserve the mild flavour

edibility.taste: Edible but not commonly eaten. Meat is found in the wings with cartilaginous texture. Flavor similar to lobster and crab but can be tough if not prepa红 correctly
edibility.notes: DANGEROUS: Venomous tail spine can inflict severe wounds. Only edible part is the wing meat. Cut wings off first, then skin carefully. Meat becomes tender when cooked properly. Pour boiling water on skin to make removal easier. NOT RECOMMENDED for inexperienced handlers due to safety risks

edibility.taste: Edible but not commonly eaten. Wing meat has cartilaginous texture similar to shark. Can be quite tough if overcooked
edibility.notes: DANGEROUS: Venomous spine on tail can cause severe injury. Due to large size and dangerous tail spine, consider cutting the line to release. If handling, remove wings and skin carefully. Only experienced handlers should attempt preparation. Safety is paramount

edibility.taste: Small schooling fish that can be eaten but rarely targeted specifically. Semi-transparent with 银y appearance and delicate texture
edibility.notes: Very small fish usually eaten whole. Often forms large schools. Can be prepa红 like 白bait when caught in sufficient numbers. Only live about one year. More important as forage fish for larger species than as human food

regulations.protection: Protected species - Listed as Vulnerable under EPBC Act

edibility.taste: Not applicable - protected species
edibility.notes: PROTECTED SPECIES: Listed as Vulnerable under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999. One of the rarest endemic freshwater fishes of south西部 Australia. Found only in acidic, tannin-stained freshwater pools, streams and lakes within 30km of the coast. Take is prohibited. Focus should be on conservation.

edibility.taste: Not typically consumed as food. Primarily used as fishing bait rather than human consumption
edibility.notes: Bloodworms are not commonly eaten by humans and are primarily harvested for use as fishing bait. They are marine worms that live in muddy or sandy bottoms. While technically edible, they have little culinary value and are not conside红 a food item. Their main value is as excellent bait for fishing various species of fish.

edibility.taste: Creamy, sweet, and briny with buttery texture. Five tongues of roe (gonads) vary from off-白 to vivid ochre. Prized delicacy in many cultures
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of Australia's most prized seafood delicacies. Highly valued in Japanese cuisine as uni. Best when in peak nutrient-rich stage before spawning. Purple urchin makes up majority of commercial catch. Can cost $5-8 whole or hund红s for premium processed roe. Environmental impact: overpopulation creates 'barrens' - consumption recommended.

edibility.taste: Good eating table fish with firm 白 flesh. Popular commercial species with mild flavor and low oiliness
edibility.notes: Popular sporting fish and commercial species. Firm 白 flesh that benefits from a few hours in the fridge before filleting to allow flesh to firm. Fantastic when baked whole in oven or BBQ. Can be batte红, crumbed, grilled, steamed or roasted. Legal fish >30cm provide best yield - smaller fish better released.

edibility.taste: Good eating with firm 白 flesh similar to other groupers. Mild flavor and low oil content
edibility.notes: CONSERVATION CONCERN: This is a rare endemic species with limited distribution. Site-associated and vulnerable to overfishing. Many anglers now practice catch and release for this iconic temperate reef species. Consider releasing to help maintain populations, especially larger breeding individuals.

edibility.taste: Among the most sought-after reef fishes worldwide. Delicate, mild and sweet flavor with fine 白 flakes. Premium eating quality
edibility.notes: Premium eating fish highly prized for their exceptional quality. The coral 鳟鱼 group includes some of the finest eating reef fish available. Best cooked simply to preserve their delicate flavors. High-priced finfish with impressive appearance. Avoid overcooking as the delicate flesh can become dry.

edibility.taste: Sweet, delicate flavor similar to marine prawns but with a fresher, cleaner taste. Tender texture with firm bite
edibility.notes: Excellent eating when fresh. Native 澳大利亚 freshwater prawns with sweet flesh similar to marine prawns. Best prepa红 simply to highlight natural sweetness. Remove from freshwater and cook promptly for best flavor. Popular in Asian cuisine and increasingly featu红 in 澳大利亚 restaurants.

edibility.taste: Sweet, tender meat with delicate flavor. Conside红 superior to marine lobster by many. Firm texture with clean, fresh taste
edibility.notes: Native Queensland crayfish now farmed extensively. Boutique crustacean with spectacular appearance and delicate texture. Popular in fine dining. Best prepa红 with garlic, butter, chilli and lime. Quick cooking essential - overcooking makes meat tough. Tail meat and claw meat both excellent eating.

edibility.taste: Size dependent quality. Small GT (1.5-7kg) have 白, firm flesh with mild meaty flavor. Large GT have very dry flesh and may contain ciguatoxin
edibility.notes: Best eating quality from 1.5-7kg specimens. Immediate bleeding and icing essential for optimal taste. Fresh prefer红 over frozen. Risk of ciguatera poisoning in larger fish. Small GT excellent for sashimi when handled properly

edibility.taste: Strong but not overpowering flavor with medium to firm texture. Dry flesh that benefits from marinating. Excellent for sashimi when fresh
edibility.notes: Superb eating qualities with few bones easily removed. Dry flesh requires marinating or serving with sauce. Fresh fish far preferable to frozen. Popular served fried with chips. Smoking 红uces oiliness

edibility.taste: Medium flavor with medium oiliness and moist, firm flesh. Reddish to burgundy colo红 meat. Superior eating quality raw or cooked
edibility.notes: Sought after by Japanese for sushi and sashimi with superb eating qualities raw. High-priced tuna after Southern Bluefin. Firm flesh holds together well in soups and curries. Best sea红 and left rare centrally

edibility.taste: Firm, thick fillets with mild meaty flavor. White flesh with excellent texture. Pound for pound the hardest fighting fish
edibility.notes: Important commercial fish caught primarily with pole and line. Excellent eating quality with firm flesh. May be ciguatoxic in adults. Popular for sport fishing due to inc红ible fighting ability. Marketed canned and frozen

edibility.taste: Good eating if not choice quality when properly bled and iced. Firm texture with moderate flavor, better than mackerel tuna
edibility.notes: Neritic tuna species with good eating qualities. Important to bleed and ice immediately after capture. Forms schools with other tuna species. Prized coastal pelagic fish accessible near shore where schools feed on baitfish

edibility.taste: Poorest eating quality of locally encounte红 tuna species. Dark, strong-flavo红 meat with metallic notes. Generally used for bait
edibility.notes: Conside红 the poorest eating quality among 澳大利亚 tuna species. Commonly used as mud crab bait due to strong flavor and dark meat. Forms multi-species schools with other scombrids. Better handled immediately and bled to improve quality

edibility.taste: Light tuna with delicious flavor when fresh. Close to 黑fin and 黄鳍 quality. Sweet and flavorful meat with good texture
edibility.notes: Most canned 'light tuna' is skipjack. Very high in selenium and omega-3 fatty acids. Low mercury levels make it safe for frequent consumption. Spawns early and grows quickly, making it sustainable. Best when bled immediately and kept on ice

edibility.taste: Premium sashimi-grade tuna with rich, buttery flavor. Conside红 among the world's finest tuna with exceptional marbling and texture. Deep 红 flesh with excellent fat content
edibility.notes: Highly prized worldwide for sashimi and sushi. Australia is a major producer through sustainable ranching operations. Often commands premium prices in Japanese markets. Best quality comes from properly bled and handled fish. The belly (toro) is particularly sought after for its high fat content

edibility.taste: Delicate mild to medium flavour with low oiliness. Moist, firm flesh with large flakes and few bones, which are easily removed
edibility.notes: Superior quality tropical snapper suitable for sushi and sashimi. Medium to high-priced finfish. Flesh works well in fish cakes, holds together well in soups and curries, and can be cubed for kebabs. Good fish to cook whole

edibility.taste: High-quality sashimi-grade tuna with mild, sweet flavor. Firm texture with bright 红 color. Less fatty than 蓝fin but still excellent quality
edibility.notes: Highly valued for sashimi and sushi worldwide. Often called 'Ahi' in Hawaiian cuisine. Lower mercury levels than some larger tuna species. Best when properly bled and iced immediately. Popular for both commercial and recreational fishing

edibility.taste: Conside红 one of the best eating fish in tropical waters. Mild, delicate flavor with firm 白 flesh. Sweet taste with no fishy flavor
edibility.notes: Highly prized gamefish and table fare. Called 'Ono' (delicious) in Hawaiian, which says it all. Fast-growing and sustainable. Flesh is excellent fresh, salted, or frozen. Popular in restaurants and highly sought after by recreational anglers

edibility.taste: Good eating grouper with firm 白 flesh. Mild flavor typical of reef-associated groupers. Fine texture and moist flesh when properly cooked
edibility.notes: Minor commercial species but good table fish. Similar to other groupers in eating quality. Should be handled carefully to maintain flesh quality. Best cooked fresh rather than frozen. Part of the diverse grouper family which are generally excellent eating

edibility.taste: Excellent eating fish with 白 to pale 粉红 flesh and large flakes. Little oil content with distinct flavor. Highly regarded table fish
edibility.notes: Even larger specimens are excellent eating. Popular target for recreational anglers. Prized for their eating quality and fighting ability. Important commercial species in northern Australia. Best bled and handled properly for optimal eating quality

name: Oysters (group)
scientificName: Crassostrea gigas, Saccostrea glomerata, Ostrea angasi

edibility.taste: Pacific oysters: plump, creamy texture with mild, slightly sweet and salty flavour. Sydney Rock: rich, complex five-flavour profile (sweetness, creaminess, brininess, minerality, umami). Angasi: inc红ibly flavoursome with rich depth, full body texture and subtle flintiness
edibility.notes: Australia's premium seafood delicacy. Pacific oysters grow in 12-18 months, Sydney Rock takes 3 years. Angasi are extremely rare but prized as 'oyster lover's oyster'. Best served fresh from clean waters. High in zinc, omega-3, and low calories. Seasonal availability varies by region

name: Razorshells (group)
scientificName: Ensis directus, Ensis arcuatus, Siliqua patula

edibility.taste: Sweet, tender meat with delicate flavor and firm texture. Rich salty flavour when fresh. Some describe as having a fresh cream finish
edibility.notes: Prized for their sweet flavor and tender texture. Must be purged of sand before cooking. Can be quite expensive but conside红 a delicacy. Shell is extremely sharp - handle with care. Best cooked quickly to maintain tenderness. Popular in European and Asian cuisine

edibility.taste: Sweet, delicate flavor with tender, succulent texture. Mid-sized species strike the best balance between sweetness, tenderness, and flavour
edibility.notes: Excellent value when in season - can be under $1 each for cleaned scallops with roe. Natural 'boom or bust' species dependent on ocean currents for nutrition. Season varies but typically July-December in southern Australia. Best purchased during peak season for optimal price and quality

edibility.taste: Superior texture and taste to squid. Light egg白 and 绿-melon aroma, tender texture, mild milky notes with fresh cream finish. Prefer红 over squid for sashimi
edibility.notes: Fast-breeding and fast-growing with stellar sustainability ratings. Remove second skin layer for best raw-eating experience. Cook very briefly (30 seconds) or slowly simmer for 30-45 minutes - nothing in between or it becomes tough. Cuttlefish ink prized for 黑 pasta and paella

edibility.taste: Western Rock Octopus (O. djinda) regarded by chefs worldwide as the best they've ever tasted. Naturally tender with no need to tenderize. Sweet, firm texture with delicate flavor
edibility.notes: Western Australia's O. djinda is unique to WA and naturally tender. Forms important part of Mediterranean and Japanese diets linked to longevity. High in protein, omega-3, taurine, B12, iron. Low calories and saturated fats. Excellent for health and essential amino acids

edibility.taste: Highly rated for taste and one of the most expensive fish species in WA. Sweet, firm 白 flesh with excellent flavor. Premium eating quality
edibility.notes: CAUTION: Venomous spines on dorsal and pectoral fins can inflict very painful wounds. Vulnerable to overfishing due to slow reproduction - spawns only once yearly (Sept-Nov) with small number of eggs. Protected in some areas. Each estuary has genetically unique population requiring local protection

edibility.taste: Distinctive flavor, oily, slightly dry, firm flesh with medium flakes and few bones which are easily removed. Low-medium priced fish
edibility.notes: Tends to be dry so marinating prior to cooking helps prevent drying out, as does wrapping in foil or banana leaves if baking or barbecuing. The thick skin is best removed. Remove bones easily - they are large and few in number. Five similar species are marketed as dart in Australia

edibility.taste: Supreme member of the Lutjanid family. Excellent eating quality with delicate, mild and sweet flavor. One of the finest table fish in Australia
edibility.notes: Fingermark (Golden snapper) are very slow growing - fish above 80cm are more than 20 years old and most are females. They taste superb and deserve the top position in the Lutjanid family. Fish caught in depths exceeding 8m will not survive release. A special fish that should be treated with respect

edibility.taste: Beautiful, firm 白 flesh that comes away in big, moist flakes. Sweet and delicious with delicate flavor and excellent texture
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of the finest eating flatfish. Best cooked simply to preserve the delicate flavors. Remove thick skin before cooking as it can shrink and distort the fillet. Pan-frying produces excellent results with crispy edges and tender flesh

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with firm 白 flesh. Popular sport fish with decent table qualities. Bottom scroungers and hunters with firm texture
edibility.notes: Often by-catches when targeting barramundi and mangrove jack. They make a grunting noise when taken from water. Gregarious fish that hang out in age cohorts - if you catch one, there are likely more similar sized fish in the same location. Fight well above their size

edibility.taste: Mild flavo红 with firm-grained 白 flesh and almost 'chickenability' in how it can be cooked. The 'rabbit of the sea' - plentiful, inexpensive, consistent
edibility.notes: Remove tough skin before cooking - it's earned its name 'leatherjacket' for good reason. Easy to fillet with firm flesh that holds together very well. Superb in curries and excellent for fish balls. Best cooked on the bone where they remain soft and juicy. Great shelf life and recession buster fish

edibility.taste: Excellent food fish with firm 白 flesh, mild flavor and good texture. Very popular angling species with premium eating quality
edibility.notes: Can grow to 2m in length and is a very popular angling species. Known for their ability to make sounds (croakers and drums family). Must be bled immediately after capture for best eating quality. Large specimens provide substantial fillets with excellent yield

edibility.taste: Conside红 excellent eating fish, better than barramundi by many. Premium eating quality with firm 白 flesh and excellent flavor
edibility.notes: One of Australia's premier sport fish. Hard fighters that put up great battles. Popular target for anglers from October to March. Can be caught in estuaries, freshwater sections of rivers, and around reefs. Aggressive feeding behavior - will attack baits and lures forcefully

edibility.taste: Edible but not highly regarded as table fish. Can be consumed but better options are available. Soft flesh with moderate flavor
edibility.notes: Endemic 澳大利亚 fish species. Not commonly targeted for food but can be eaten. Usually caught as bycatch. Better suited for catch and release or use as bait for other species. Distinctive long fins make them easy to identify

edibility.taste: Edible but not conside红 premium eating. Can have strong flavor depending on diet. Better preparation requi红 for good results
edibility.notes: Schooling species often seen in large aggregations feeding on plankton well above the seabed. Grey coloration often with tinge of 蓝, 绿 or brown. Found on rocky reefs in coastal waters. Not commonly targeted for food but can be prepa红 well with proper techniques

edibility.taste: Commonly regarded as one of the worst rated table fishes in Australia. Ironically one of the most commonly caught by new spearfishers. Can be improved with proper preparation
edibility.notes: Brain spike (ike-jime), bleed immediately, and ice properly to improve quality. Remove any blood line from fillets. Delicate and flaky flesh - handle gently. Better when cooked in curries or heavily seasoned. Smoking can improve the flavor significantly. Often called 'Mother-in-law' by anglers - you wouldn't want to take them home!

edibility.taste: Light to medium flavor with pleasant taste. Light colo红 flesh. Not a Ciguatera risk like some other barracuda species. Should be kept well chilled and eaten fresh
edibility.notes: Pacific Barracuda is safe to eat as it doesn't live in reef environments. Can be cooked by most methods. Flesh stays firm in wet cooking, good for soups and stews. Avoid reef barracuda from other regions due to Ciguatera toxin risk. Must be kept well chilled to prevent histamine poisoning.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and mild to moderate flavor. Conside红 one of the finest table fish by many anglers. Clean, sweet taste
edibility.notes: Highly prized table fish with excellent eating quality. Flesh is firm and 白 with good flavor. Often found around floating objects, making them vulnerable to easy capture. Should be bled immediately for best quality. Excellent for various cooking methods.

name: 鲑鱼, 西部 澳大利亚

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with firm flesh and rich flavor. High oil content fish. Best when fresh and properly handled. Bleed immediately after capture for best quality
edibility.notes: Abundant and affordable fish during spawning runs. High oil content makes them excellent for smoking and grilling. Must be kept well chilled and eaten fresh. Bleed and ice immediately after capture. Popular target for recreational anglers. Best prepa红 with strong flavors like tomatoes, olives and herbs.

edibility.taste: Conside红 one of Australia's premier table fish. Sweet, delicate flavour with firm, moist flesh. Unique iodine burst on the back palate. Dover Sole characteristics
edibility.notes: Premium eating fish with inc红ibly sweet flavour. Delicate and flaky flesh requiring gentle handling. Best cooked with plenty of moisture and medium heat. Remove skin and pin bones before cooking. 澳大利亚 fish experience par excellence. Often called the best eating fish in southern Australia.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm 白 flesh and mild flavor. One of the largest groupers with premium taste. Clean, sweet flesh with good texture
edibility.notes: Large grouper with excellent eating quality. Firm 白 flesh that's highly prized. Should be bled immediately after capture. Can grow very large - specimens over 2m have been recorded. Territorial and typically found under ledges and in caves. Handle with caution due to size and strength.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality but illegal to catch in Australia. Protected species. Firm 白 flesh with good flavor when legally available from aquaculture. High commercial value
edibility.notes: PROTECTED SPECIES IN AUSTRALIA - Illegal to catch and heavy fines apply. The largest bony fish found on coral reefs. Can grow to 3m and 600kg. Has excellent eating quality but is now farmed commercially in some countries. Highly vulnerable to overfishing due to slow growth and long lifespan.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality but PROTECTED SPECIES - illegal to catch. Highly valued in live fish trade. Firm flesh with good flavor when legally available. Premium seafood in Asian markets
edibility.notes: PROTECTED SPECIES - Illegal to catch in many areas including Australia. Listed as Endange红 by IUCN. Extremely vulnerable due to slow growth, late maturity, and overfishing pressure. Highly valued in live fish trade. Critical to reef ecosystem as they eat crown-of-thorns starfish. Can live over 30 years.

edibility.taste: NOT EDIBLE - Fully protected species. Illegal to catch, possess or consume. South Australia's marine emblem. Extremely delicate creature
edibility.notes: FULLY PROTECTED SPECIES - Illegal to catch, handle, or consume. Heavy fines and prison time apply. South Australia's marine emblem and tourism icon. Near threatened species requiring strict conservation. Endemic to southern 澳大利亚 waters. Extremely delicate and sensitive to disturbance. Critical to marine ecosystem and ecotourism industry.

edibility.taste: Underrated diamond in the rough. Clean, rich flavor when caught in saltwater. Juicy, slightly oily flesh with medium to strong flavor. Highly nutritious and affordable
edibility.notes: Australia's most underrated fish - cheaper than potatoes during spawning runs. Inc红ibly nutritious and abundant. Best when caught in clear saltwater. Avoid those from muddy freshwater. Excellent with Mediterranean flavors like tomato, olive and basil. Popular in Filipino and Asian cuisines. High oil content makes it perfect for smoking and grilling.

edibility.taste: COMPLETELY ILLEGAL TO CATCH OR CONSUME - Western Australia's marine emblem. Fully protected under state and federal law. World's largest fish
edibility.notes: FULLY PROTECTED SPECIES - Illegal to catch, harm, or consume anywhere in 澳大利亚 waters. Western Australia's marine emblem. World's largest living fish. Gentle filter-feeding giant completely harmless to humans. Critical to marine ecosystem and worth millions in ecotourism. Swimming with whale sharks is only permitted through licensed tour operators at Ningaloo Marine Park. Severe penalties for any interference.

edibility.taste: COMPLETELY ILLEGAL TO CATCH OR CONSUME - Critically endange红 species. All sawfish species are federally protected under CITES Appendix I and 澳大利亚 law
edibility.notes: FULLY PROTECTED SPECIES - Illegal to catch, harm, or consume anywhere in 澳大利亚 waters. All sawfish species are critically endange红 and listed under CITES Appendix I. Severe penalties including heavy fines and imprisonment apply for any interference. These ancient rays have declined by up to 95% and face extinction. Only Australia still has relatively viable populations. Essential for marine ecosystem health.

edibility.taste: NOT EDIBLE - Protected species in most 澳大利亚 states. Illegal to catch, possess or consume. Marine emblem of Victoria
edibility.notes: PROTECTED SPECIES - Illegal to take or export in most 澳大利亚 states where they occur. Victoria's marine emblem. Vulnerable to climate change and marine heatwaves. Important for marine ecosystem and ecotourism. Currently experiencing significant population declines due to environmental pressures. Heavy penalties apply for capture or interference.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and mild flavour. Medium oiliness with fine flakes and few bones easily removed. Sweet and delicate taste
edibility.notes: Popular angling species commonly captu红 with hook and line. Highly regarded table fish with firm flesh that holds together well in soups, curries and casseroles. Can be cubed for kebabs. Thick skin is usually removed. The bones make excellent stock. Score large whole fish at thickest part for even heat penetration.

edibility.taste: Not recommended for consumption - Too small for practical eating and important native freshwater species. No commercial or recreational fishing value
edibility.notes: Small native freshwater fish endemic to south西部 Australia. Important part of freshwater ecosystem. Fast-swimming schooling fish found in clear water pools, rivers, and shallow lakes. Can tolerate brackish and acidic water. Spawns in small streams during wet season. Lives up to 5 years and becomes sexually mature at 1 year. Too small for consumption and should be left to maintain healthy freshwater ecosystems.

edibility.taste: NOT EDIBLE - Extremely small native freshwater fish. Too tiny for any practical consumption and important for ecosystem health
edibility.notes: One of Australia's smallest native freshwater fish, endemic to south西部 Western Australia. Found in small wetlands, swamps, and seasonal pools. Can survive in temporary water bodies by aestivating in crayfish burrows during dry periods. Annual species with adults dying after spawning. Extremely important for freshwater ecosystem balance. Conservation dependent on habitat protection and water quality maintenance.

edibility.taste: NOT EDIBLE - Endange红 species. Extremely small native freshwater fish with declining populations. Illegal to take or harm
edibility.notes: ENDANGERED SPECIES by IUCN with decreasing population trend. One of Australia's smallest and rarest native freshwater fish, endemic to south西部 Western Australia. Found only in very limited habitat in freshwater wetlands and seasonal pools. Life span only 1 year. Faces severe threats from habitat loss, water extraction, and climate change. Critical conservation priority requiring habitat protection and restoration. Collection or disturbance is prohibited.

edibility.taste: Not recommended for consumption - Primitive vertebrate with unique biology. Not commonly eaten in Australia though consumed traditionally in some cultures
edibility.notes: Ancient primitive vertebrate, not technically a fish but a jawless agnathan. Anadromous species with complex life cycle - larvae (ammocoetes) live in freshwater sediments for several years before metamorphosing into parasitic adults that migrate to sea. Adults attach to large fish and marine mammals using circular sucker mouth. Important ecological role as both filter feeder (larvae) and in marine food webs. Remarkable survivors having existed for over 500 million years.

edibility.taste: NOT EDIBLE - Extremely rare and unique endemic species. Too small for consumption and critically important for scientific research and conservation
edibility.notes: Unique and remarkable endemic fish found only in small seasonal pools near Margaret River, Western Australia. One of the world's most unusual freshwater fish with extraordinary adaptations - can survive out of water for months by aestivating in moist soil and leaf litter. Has ability to bend its body backwards over its head like a salamander (hence the name). Only member of family Lepidogalaxiidae. Extremely important for understanding fish evolution and adaptation. Vulnerable to climate change and habitat disturbance.

edibility.taste: NOT EDIBLE - Tiny native freshwater fish. Too small for any practical consumption and important for ecosystem health
edibility.notes: Small native freshwater fish endemic to south西部 Western Australia. Found in permanent freshwater bodies including rivers, streams, and lakes with clear water and rocky or sandy bottoms. Often found among aquatic vegetation. Important p红ator of aquatic invertebrates and prey for larger fish species. Lives up to several years and spawns in spring. Plays crucial role in freshwater food webs and should be left undisturbed to maintain ecosystem balance.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality. Firm 白 flesh with somewhat fishy flavour and medium to high oiliness. Perfect for sashimi when fresh. One of the best table fish
edibility.notes: Highly underrated species that's abundant and available year-round. Fights extremely hard for its size. Excellent when prepa红 as sashimi - remove all 红 meat and serve fresh on same day. Tends to be dry when cooked so marinating helps, as does wrapping in foil or banana leaves when baking/barbecuing. Particularly excellent at places like Lord Howe Island where they grow to massive sizes. 'Being indeed the salmon of St. Helena' according to historical accounts.

edibility.taste: High edibility rating with 白, moist and flaky flesh. Excellent eating quality, similar to other groupers. Draws comparisons with smoked cod texture
edibility.notes: Highly rated eating fish among the grouper family. The flesh is 白, moist and flaky with excellent texture. Often conside红 superior to snapper and pearl perch by those who have tasted it. Popular in both commercial and recreational fisheries for its eating quality.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and mild flavour. Similar to other quality bream species. Good texture and clean taste
edibility.notes: High-quality table fish similar to other premium bream species. Popular target for recreational anglers in northwest Australia. Best prepa红 fresh and handles various cooking methods well. Part of the highly regarded Sparidae family known for excellent eating quality.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with firm 白 flesh. Mild to moderate flavour typical of the lutjanid family. Pleasant taste when prepa红 well
edibility.notes: Excellent light tackle sport fish that provides good eating. Previously undervalued but gaining recognition for both recreational fishing and table quality. Sharp needle-like teeth require careful handling. Slow growing and long-lived (up to 20-30 years), making them vulnerable to overfishing. Best when humanely killed and iced immediately.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm 白 flesh. One of the most prized table fish in northern Australia. Sweet, clean flavour with good texture
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish and important species in Northern Territory, Queensland and Western Australia fisheries. Don't freeze well so consume fresh. Protandrous hermaphrodite - starts as male then changes to female. Use sensory whiskers to hunt prey in turbid waters. Hardy fish that handles catch and release well when using appropriate tackle.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm 白 flesh. Highly prized table fish throughout northern Australia. Clean, sweet flavour with good texture
edibility.notes: Group includes both 蓝 threadfin (Eleutheronema tetradactylum) and king threadfin (Polydactylus macrochir). Don't freeze well so best consumed fresh. Use sensory whiskers to hunt in turbid shallow waters. Protandrous hermaphrodites that change from male to female. Important commercial and recreational species.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and excellent flavour. One of Australia's premier table fish. Sweet, clean taste with perfect texture
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of the finest eating fish in 澳大利亚 waters. Highly prized by both recreational and commercial fishers. Slow growing and long-lived, requiring careful management. Best prepa红 fresh with minimal seasoning to highlight natural flavour. Commands premium prices in restaurants.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with 白, firm flesh. Mild flavour typical of lutjanid family. Pleasant taste when prepa红 well
edibility.notes: Smaller member of the snapper family with good eating qualities. Often caught while targeting other reef species. Best prepa红 fresh and simply cooked to highlight natural flavour. Part of the regulated demersal fishery due to conservation concerns.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm, meaty flesh. Rich in vitamins A and B. Mild flavour when prepa红 properly. High-quality table fish
edibility.notes: World's fastest fish capable of 68 mph speeds. Excellent sport fish and high-quality eating. Soak fillets in milk for 30 minutes to remove strong odors, then season with lemon juice, garlic and spices. Cook gently to retain nutrients. Often used for making fish dip when smoked. Practice catch and release when possible due to their sporting value.

edibility.taste: NOT RECOMMENDED - Critically endange红 species protected under 澳大利亚 law. Consumption is prohibited
edibility.notes: PROTECTED SPECIES - Speartooth sharks are critically endange红 and fully protected under 澳大利亚 wildlife protection laws. These rare river sharks are among the world's most endange红 shark species. Any capture must be reported to authorities and fish must be released immediately. Population has declined by over 80% in recent decades. Essential for ecosystem health in northern 澳大利亚 river systems.

edibility.taste: High-quality eating fish with 白, firm flesh and excellent flavour. One of the premium snappers with clean, sweet taste and perfect texture
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish with excellent commercial and recreational value. Similar quality to other premium snappers. Best prepa红 fresh with minimal seasoning to highlight natural flavour. Forage mostly at night. Important commercial species in Indo-Pacific region.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and excellent flavour. One of Australia's premier table fish. Sweet, clean taste with perfect texture
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of the finest eating fish in 澳大利亚 waters. Highly prized by both recreational and commercial fishers. Slow growing and long-lived, requiring careful management. Best prepa红 fresh with minimal seasoning to highlight natural flavour. Commands premium prices in restaurants.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with firm, 白 to pale 粉红 flesh. Premium deep-water snapper with excellent texture and delicate flavour
edibility.notes: One of the most prized deep-water snappers. Caught at depths typically between 100-400m. Commands high prices in fish markets due to excellent eating quality. Best prepa红 fresh to highlight natural flavour. Important commercial species in tropical and subtropical waters.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with 白, firm flesh and delicate flavour. Premium commercial and recreational species with clean, sweet taste
edibility.notes: Important commercial species in northern 澳大利亚 waters. Caught primarily by commercial trawl and line fisheries. Forms schools over continental shelf and slope areas. Best prepa红 fresh with simple cooking methods to highlight natural flavour.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality when properly prepa红. Firm, 白 flesh with mild to moderate flavour. Some risk of ciguatera in tropical reef areas
edibility.notes: CAUTION: Large barracuda from tropical reef areas may carry ciguatera toxin. 澳大利亚 barracuda are generally safe but should be sourced carefully. Excellent when grilled or barbecued. Remove dark meat from centerline before cooking. Best prepa红 with strong flavours like garlic, lemon, and herbs.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with 粉红ish-colou红 flesh that is firm and 白 when cooked. Tasty and well-suited to smoking
edibility.notes: PARASITES WARNING: Flesh can occasionally contain parasitic worms - cooking destroys them completely. NEVER eat raw. Despite this, barracouta is excellent eating when cooked. Many long, flexible bones are easily removed after cooking. Popular for smoking. School in large numbers making them easy to catch when present.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and mild flavour. Superior texture compa红 to kingfish, retains moisture when cooked
edibility.notes: Conside红 one of the finest eating fish - often called a 'great dad fish' because it won't dry out even if overcooked. Can be cooked with skin and scales on, which crisp up like duck skin. Fast growing aquaculture species with excellent commercial potential. Belongs to remora family but doesn't have sucker disc.

edibility.taste: Good edible quality flesh with firm texture. Especially tasty when smoked. Clean 白 meat when cooked
edibility.notes: The flesh is of good edible quality and especially tasty when smoked. Important commercial species in southern 澳大利亚 waters. Schools migrate along continental slope during winter spawning runs. Deep-water species typically caught at 300-450m depth. Stock in eastern Australia has been subject to poor recruitment since 1989.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with meaty, lean flesh. One of the finest tropical mackerels with firm texture and mild flavour
edibility.notes: Much larger than Blue 鲭鱼 (up to 100 times larger) with meatier, leaner flesh. More appropriate for cutting into cutlets with less-edible skin. Spanish 鲭鱼 is conside红 the greatest of tropical mackerels, but most people struggle to distinguish between Grey, School, and Spotted once cooked. Marketed fresh and frozen; eaten fried, broiled and baked.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with meaty, lean flesh. One of the tropical mackerels with firm texture and good flavour
edibility.notes: One of the tropical mackerels with much larger size than Blue 鲭鱼. Meaty, leaner flesh more appropriate for cutting into cutlets with less-edible skin. Spanish 鲭鱼 is conside红 the greatest of tropical mackerels, but most people struggle to distinguish between Grey, School, and Spotted once cooked. School in open waters and sometimes move into inshore bays.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality, utilized as a food fish. Forms schools near reefs and feeds during rising tides in shallow waters
edibility.notes: Form schools near individual bays and reefs in Barrier Reef waters. With rising tide, they move into shallow water over reef flats, feeding on schools of clupeoid fishes. Commercial and gamefish species. Found mostly in shallow reef waters where it forms large schools.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with meaty, lean flesh. One of the tropical mackerels with firm texture and excellent flavour. Highly prized catch
edibility.notes: Easily identified with four rows of large 黑 spots over its sides. Found more commonly in offshore, open waters away from reefs. Form large schools which move close inshore along coast, commonly taken December-April/May. Much larger than Blue 鲭鱼 with meatier flesh. Reports of possible ciguatera poisoning in some areas.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality group with firm, 白 flesh and outstanding flavour. Among Australia's premier table fish species
edibility.notes: Includes many of Australia's most prized eating fish species such as 红 emperor, goldband snapper, crimson snapper, and various sea perch species. Highly valued commercially and recreationally. Slow growing and long-lived, requiring careful management. Best prepa红 fresh with minimal seasoning to highlight natural flavours.

edibility.taste: Variable eating quality depending on species and preparation. Wings from larger rays are good eating, similar to scallops when properly prepa红
edibility.notes: SAFETY WARNING: Many rays have venomous barbs - handle with extreme care. Best eating size is wingspan 18 inches to 2 feet. Larger rays can be tough but are good parboiled. Wings contain cartilage instead of bones. Meat from guitarfish tails similar to flathead. Eagle ray wings have unique texture between pork and prawn. Requires skinning and careful preparation.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and excellent flavour. Among the most prized fish in 澳大利亚 waters
edibility.notes: Includes many of Australia's most prized eating fish including 红 emperor, spangled emperor, and various seabream. Slow growing and long-lived species requiring careful management. Command premium prices in restaurants and fish markets. Best prepa红 simply to highlight natural flavours.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with firm, 白, flaky flesh and mild flavour. Similar to other catfish species with low oiliness
edibility.notes: VENOMOUS SPINES WARNING: Dorsal and pectoral fins have venomous spines that can inflict painful wounds. Handle with extreme care. Skinning recommended before cooking as skin can have strong flavour. Popular target for recreational anglers in estuaries. Flesh is excellent when filleted and cooked properly.

edibility.taste: Variable eating quality depending on species and size. Larger wrasse can be good eating, but many are important for reef ecosystem health
edibility.notes: CONSERVATION NOTE: Many wrasse and parrotfish species are crucial for reef health as cleaners and algae grazers. Large humphead Maori wrasse are protected species. Smaller species generally have limited eating value. Best to release these important reef fish to maintain ecosystem balance.

edibility.taste: Eating quality varies greatly depending on the specific species. Some excellent, others poor or inedible
edibility.notes: This category covers all other finfish species not specifically listed elsewhere. Eating quality, cooking methods, and handling requirements vary greatly by species. Always positively identify fish before consumption and check current regulations. Some species may be protected or have special handling requirements.

edibility.taste: Eating quality varies greatly by species. Many are excellent eating while others are not suitable for consumption
edibility.notes: This category covers all other crustacean species not specifically listed. Includes many excellent eating species like crabs, prawns, and lobsters. Always ensure proper identification and check current regulations. Some species may have seasonal closures or size limits. Cook thoroughly to avoid foodborne illness.

edibility.taste: Soft, delicate and earthy flavour with firm, not mushy bite. Often called 'manna from heaven' when properly prepa红
edibility.notes: 澳大利亚 native freshwater crustacean with excellent eating quality. Best cooked live in fast-bubbling salted water, then refreshed in icy water. Traditionally eaten with 白 bread, butter and brown vinegar. Takes on conditions of water they grow in, so taste varies by location. Can be sto红 out of water for up to a week when kept damp and cool. Featu红 at premium restaurants like Bennelong.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and mild to moderate flavour. Quality varies by species and size
edibility.notes: Includes various species from queenfish to large trevally and kingfish. Smaller species generally better eating quality. Some larger species can have strong flavour or parasites. Popular recreational fishing targets known for their fighting ability. Best eating when fresh and properly handled.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and excellent flavour. Among Australia's most popular recreational fishing targets
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish throughout Australia. Black bream particularly well-regarded for eating quality. Firm, 白, flaky flesh with sweet, mild flavour. Popular in estuaries and coastal waters. Responds well to simple cooking methods that highlight natural flavour. Important recreational fishery species.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with 粉红ish flesh that is oily and flavourful. Often called 'chicken of the sea' for its fine eating qualities
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish and important commercial species. Pinkish flesh is oily and suitable for many cooking methods. Most caught in New Zealand/澳大利亚 waters is frozen and sent for canning. Excellent for serving raw as sashimi. Must be bled immediately and kept very cold to prevent spoilage. Premium gamefish known for powerful runs and strong fights.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with 白, flaky flesh and mild flavour. Popular aquaculture species worldwide
edibility.notes: INVASIVE SPECIES WARNING: Most cichlids and tilapia are introduced species that can cause serious environmental damage to native ecosystems. Many jurisdictions prohibit their release or transport. Despite environmental concerns, they are good eating fish when legally obtained. Popular in aquaculture due to fast growth and mild taste.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and excellent flavour. One of northern Australia's most prized table fish
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish and one of Australia's premier table fish species. Firm, 白, flaky flesh with sweet, delicate flavour. Distinguished by long thread-like pectoral fin rays. Important commercial and recreational species. Can grow very large, with specimens over 40kg recorded. Best eating when fresh and properly handled.

edibility.taste: Eating quality varies greatly by species. Some are excellent eating while others are protected or not suitable for consumption
edibility.notes: CONSERVATION CRITICAL: Many native freshwater fish are threatened or protected species. Always check current regulations before targeting or keeping native species. Murray cod, 鳟鱼 cod, and many others have strict size limits, closed seasons, or complete protection. Prioritize conservation and catch-and-release practices. Some species like 金 perch and 银 perch can be good eating when legally harvested.

edibility.taste: Not suitable for human consumption. These are marine organisms, not fish
edibility.notes: IMPORTANT: This category covers coral and live rock, which are marine invertebrates, not fish. They are not edible and are often protected by environmental regulations. 珊瑚 reefs are critical marine ecosystems that support biodiversity and require conservation. Removal or damage to coral may be illegal and harmful to marine environments.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality when fresh. Often oily and flavorful, best when eaten whole or processed
edibility.notes: Important food source for larger fish and seabirds. Many species are excellent eating when fresh - sardines, anchovies, and 白bait are particularly prized. Often used as bait but also valuable as food fish. High in omega-3 fatty acids. Some species like 白bait command premium prices. Should be consumed very fresh due to high oil content.

edibility.taste: Conside红 excellent eating and among the best eating reef fish species. White meat similar to grouper but very meaty and fleshy
edibility.notes: CONSERVATION STATUS: Near Threatened (IUCN). Highly sought after food fish throughout its distribution and high on the list of regularly caught species by recreational fishers. Protogynous hermaphrodite with very low numbers of males. Heavy fishing pressure has caused severe declines in some areas like Hong Kong. First documented example of tool use in wild fish - uses rocks to break open clams.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm, 白 flesh. Highly regarded among wrasse species for eating quality
edibility.notes: Highly prized eating fish from the tuskfish group. Similar to 黑spot tuskfish in eating quality. Found on reefs and rocky areas where they use their strong teeth to crush molluscs and crustaceans. Popular target for recreational anglers. Best prepa红 simply to highlight natural flavour.

edibility.taste: Outstanding eating quality with firm, 粉红 to 白 flesh and excellent flavour. One of the world's premier table fish
edibility.notes: INTRODUCED SPECIES: Successfully introduced to Australia from Europe in 1867. One of the most important sport fish in Australia. Found in cool waters above 600m with moderate to swift flow. Sea-run browns are 银 and feed on baitfish. River browns are darker with spots. Closed seasons apply in many areas to protect spawning. Requires fishing license. Highly prized by recreational anglers worldwide.

edibility.taste: Eating quality varies by species. Some like carp can be good eating when properly prepa红, others not recommended
edibility.notes: ENVIRONMENTAL THREAT: These are invasive pest species that cause serious damage to 澳大利亚 freshwater ecosystems. MUST NOT BE RETURNED TO WATER if caught - this is often legally requi红. Can displace native species, degrade water quality, and destroy habitat. European carp is edible but bony. Most other pest species not recommended for consumption. Check local regulations - some areas require immediate destruction of these species.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and mild flavour. Small but tasty fish often caught as bycatch
edibility.notes: Small deep-water fish related to nannygai. Often caught as bycatch during deep-water fishing. Despite small size, they are good eating with sweet, firm flesh. Usually cooked whole due to small size. Found in deeper waters and more active at night. Part of the berycid family known for good eating quality.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with firm, 白 flesh and sweet flavour. Highly regarded among deep-water fish
edibility.notes: Deep-water species related to nannygai and part of the berycid family known for excellent eating quality. Caught primarily in deeper waters off the continental shelf. Despite being called '红fish', it's not related to true 红fish/红 snapper. Firm, sweet 白 flesh makes it highly prized by fishers. Often caught as part of mixed deep-water catches.

name: Molluscs and invertebrates – all other species

edibility.taste: Eating quality varies by species but many are excellent. 鲍鱼s, scallops, and mussels are highly prized for their sweet, tender flesh
edibility.notes: This diverse group includes many of Australia's most prized seafood species. 鲍鱼s command premium prices for their tender, sweet meat. Scallops are prized for their delicate flavor. Mussels are excellent steamed with wine and herbs. Check specific regulations for each species as some have strict size limits, seasonal closures, or bag limits. Many require special licenses or permits.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with sweet, tender flesh. Pipis and cockles are highly prized for their delicate flavor similar to clams
edibility.notes: Traditional food source for Indigenous 澳大利亚s and Asian communities. Cockles taste similar to razor clams with sweet, savoury flavor. Best collected at low tide from sandy beaches and estuaries. Pipis are particularly prized - can be eaten raw or cooked. Excellent in Asian stir-fries with garlic, ginger, and chili, or steamed with 白 wine. Check minimum size limits (usually 3.5cm). Allow to purge sand in seawater before cooking.

edibility.taste: Eating quality varies greatly by species. Some are good eating while others are collected primarily for their decorative shells
edibility.notes: DANGER WARNING: Some cone shells are extremely venomous and potentially deadly - never handle live cone shells with bare hands! These molluscs are collected primarily for their beautiful shells rather than food. Turban shells and some other species are edible and conside红 good eating. Many specimen shells are protected or have strict collection limits. Check regulations carefully as some areas prohibit collection entirely. Primarily valued for shell collecting, aquarium trade, and decoration rather than food.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality with sweet, delicate flesh. Criminally underappreciated on 澳大利亚 tables despite being very tasty
edibility.notes: Small and rather tasty fish that can be filleted to produce attractive boned-out butterfly fillets. Excellent for delicate dishes - advisable not to overpower the delicate flesh. 鹤鱵 crumbed whole and deep fried are excellent for fish and chips. Traditional Maltese style involves grilling whole with herbs. The 绿 bones are completely harmless and actually quite attractive. School fish found near surface at night and close to bottom over seagrass beds during day.

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality similar to southern garfish. Sweet, delicate flesh that is criminally underappreciated
edibility.notes: Similar eating quality to southern garfish with sweet, delicate flesh. Can be filleted to produce attractive boned-out butterfly fillets. Excellent for fish and chips when crumbed whole and deep fried. The 绿 bones are completely harmless and actually quite attractive. Small but tasty fish that should not be overpowe红 with strong flavors.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality when properly prepa红. Smaller sharks have sweet and delicious flesh with boneless, thick flakes
edibility.notes: CONSERVATION STATUS: Vulnerable (IUCN) with decreasing population. Smaller sharks (under 2m) have better eating quality. Marinate first in oil and lemon to tenderize the flesh. Remove skin before barbecuing. Popular for fish and chips because of boneless flakes. Large coastal p红ators that are vulnerable to overfishing due to slow growth and late maturity. Handle with extreme caution - powerful p红ator with razor-sharp teeth.

edibility.taste: One of Australia's premium eating sharks with sweet, delicious boneless flesh. Sold as 'flake' - the only 澳大利亚 shark legally allowed this name
edibility.notes: Gummy shark (Flake) is one of Australia's premium eating sharks. Sweet and delicious flesh with no bones makes it perfect for fish and chips. The only 澳大利亚 shark legally allowed to be called 'Flake'. Marinate first in oil and lemon to tenderize. Remove skin before barbecuing. Classified as 'Least Concern' and conside红 sustainable seafood due to effective fisheries management. Best time to catch is at night on rising tide.

name: 鲨鱼, 西部 spotted gummy

edibility.taste: Excellent eating quality similar to gummy shark with sweet, boneless flesh. High-quality flake for fish and chips
edibility.notes: Related to the regular gummy shark with similar excellent eating quality. Sweet and delicious flesh with no bones makes it perfect for fish and chips. Marinate first in oil and lemon to tenderize. Remove skin before barbecuing. Safe to handle due to lack of sharp teeth. Best caught at night on rising tide.

edibility.taste: Poor eating quality with tough, cartilaginous flesh. Not commonly eaten despite being harmless
edibility.notes: While harmless and docile, Port Jackson sharks are not conside红 good eating due to tough, cartilaginous flesh and strong ammonia taste. More valuable as ecotourism attraction. Completely harmless to humans - often called 'puppy dogs of the sea'. Important role in ecosystem as bottom-dwelling p红ator. Better left in the water for conservation and ecological reasons.

edibility.taste: Fair eating quality but not commonly consumed due to conservation concerns and potential safety issues
edibility.notes: DANGER: Tiger sharks are extremely dangerous apex p红ators and should never be targeted by recreational anglers. Near Threatened species that plays crucial role in marine ecosystem. While the flesh is edible, 虎 sharks are not recommended for consumption due to conservation status, potential mercury contamination, and safety risks. These powerful p红ators can reach massive sizes and are responsible for attacks on humans. Best left undisturbed in their natural habitat.

edibility.taste: Good eating quality similar to other houndshark species. Sweet flesh suitable for fish and chips
edibility.notes: Related to gummy sharks with similar eating quality. Sweet flesh that works well for fish and chips when skinned and prepa红 properly. Smaller sharks have better eating quality. Safe to handle due to lack of sharp teeth. Marinate first in oil and lemon to tenderize. Remove skin before cooking. Active at night over sandy and muddy bottoms.
